text: <@UBUNBSM24> You can mimic this by removing the `if` statements around the author spot light section.
That's a good workaround, but I also have other modules I hide on the author page so I'd have to tweak a few things!

Similar to Chad’s solution - haven’t done it for this exact purpose but something I do all the time especially if I’m working on changes to a live template. I wrap my blocks that I want to hide from normal users with `{% if request.query_dict.hsDebug%}{%endif%}` Then use the chrome extension to toggle the debug mode. So I can see what I’m working on.
add a close option to popups so i can get what is behind it
" My forms experience was ruined by the pop up asking how my forms experience is today.”
You can also use the url of the preview to show and hide some elements for testing purposes
